method: Slice the pork tenderloin into thin strips.
In a small bowl, whisk together the soy sauce, garlic, ginger, cornstarch, sesame oil, salt, and pepper.
Place the sliced pork in a separate bowl and pour the marinade over it. Toss to coat and let it marinate for 15 minutes.
Heat some oil in a large skillet or wok over high heat.
Add the marinated pork to the skillet and cook until browned and cooked through. Remove and set aside.
In the same skillet, add the broccoli florets, bell peppers, carrots, and snow peas. Cook until the vegetables are crisp-tender.
Return the cooked pork to the skillet and stir-fry for a few more minutes to combine the flavors.
Serve the pork-a-doodle stir fry over rice or noodles and enjoy!
